problems.title: Buy Maximum Items with Budget
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have a budget of B rupees.
There are N items in a shop, each with a certain price.
Find the maximum number of items you can buy within your budget.

Greedy Insight: To maximize the number of items, always buy the cheapest items first!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5 50
10 20 30 15 5

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
Budget = 50
Prices: [10, 20, 30, 15, 5]
Sorted prices: [5, 10, 15, 20, 30]

Buy item with price 5: Budget left = 45 (1 item)
Buy item with price 10: Budget left = 35 (2 items)
Buy item with price 15: Budget left = 20 (3 items)
Buy item with price 20: Budget left = 0 (4 items)? No, 20 <= 20, so yes!

Actually: 5 + 10 + 15 + 20 = 50, so we can buy 4 items.

Let me recalculate: Maximum items = 4
